intro: Pleroma albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered pleroma, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Pleroma albiflorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
